results.title: Metformin in overcoming enzalutamide resistance in castration-resistant prostate cancer.
results.text_hl: After combination treatment, we observed a decrease in cell proliferation and viability as well as a synergistic effect of both @CHEMICAL_enzalutamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C540278 @@@enzalutamide@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in vitro. Following these results, we sought to explore how combination treatment affected mitochondrial fitness using mitochondrial stress test analysis and mitochondrial membrane potential shifts due to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@'s action in inhibiting complex @<m>DISEASE_Hypersensitivity_Immediate</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006969 @@@I of@@@ oxidative phosphorylation.

citations.NLM: Simpson K, Allison DB, He D, Liu J, Wang C, Liu X. Metformin in overcoming enzalutamide resistance in castration-resistant prostate cancer. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 2025 Jan;392(1):100034. PMID: 39893002
citations.BibTeX: @article{39893002, title={Metformin in overcoming enzalutamide resistance in castration-resistant prostate cancer.}, author={Simpson K and Allison DB and He D and Liu J and Wang C and Liu X}, journal={J Pharmacol Exp Ther}, volume={392}, number={1}, pages={100034}}

results.title: Triple Therapy with Metformin, Ketogenic Diet, and Metronomic Cyclophosphamide Reduced Tumor Growth in MYCN-Amplified Neuroblastoma Xenografts
results.text_hl: The anti-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@MET@@@) also targets complex I of the OXPHOS system.

citations.NLM: Catalano L, Aminzadeh-Gohari S, Weber DD, Poupardin R, Stefan VE, Smiles WJ, Tevini J, Feichtinger RG, Derdak S, Bilban M, Bareswill S, Heimesaat MM, Kofler B. Triple Therapy with Metformin, Ketogenic Diet, and Metronomic Cyclophosphamide Reduced Tumor Growth in MYCN-Amplified Neuroblastoma Xenografts Metabolites. 2023 Aug 3;13(8):. PMID: 37623854

results.title: Metformin Downregulates the Insulin/IGF-I Signaling Pathway and Inhibits Different Uterine Serous Carcinoma (USC) Cells Proliferation and Migration in p53-Dependent or -Independent Manners
results.text_hl: Recently, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was shown to exhibit anti-proliferative effects in @<m>DISEASE_Hypersensitivity_Immediate</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006969 @@@ovarian and Type I endometrial cancer@@@, although the mechanisms responsible for this non-classical @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ action remain unclear.

citations.NLM: Sarfstein R, Friedman Y, Attias-Geva Z, Fishman A, Bruchim I, Werner H. Metformin Downregulates the Insulin/IGF-I Signaling Pathway and Inhibits Different Uterine Serous Carcinoma (USC) Cells Proliferation and Migration in p53-Dependent or -Independent Manners PLoS One. 2013;8(4):e61537. PMID: 23620761

results.title: Identification and replication of prediction models for ovulation, pregnancy and live birth in infertile women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: Both trials were double-blind, randomized clinical trials that included 626 and 750 infertile @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@, respectively. @<m>DISEASE_Hypersensitivity_Immediate</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006969 @@@PPCOS-I@@@ participants were randomized to either @CHEMICAL_Clomiphene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002996 @@@clomiphene citrate@@@ (CC), @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or their combination, and @DISEASE_Oculocutaneous_albinism_type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:C537730 @@@PPCOS-II@@@ participants to either @CHEMICAL_Letrozole @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077289 @@@letrozole@@@ or CC for up to five treatment cycles.

citations.NLM: Kuang H, Jin S, Hansen KR, Diamond MP, Coutifaris C, Casson P, Christman G, Alvero R, Huang H, Bates GW, Usadi R, Lucidi S, Baker V, Santoro N, Eisenberg E, Legro RS, Zhang H, Reproductive Medicine Network. Identification and replication of prediction models for ovulation, pregnancy and live birth in infertile women with polycystic ovary syndrome. Hum Reprod. 2015 Sep;30(9):2222-33. PMID: 26202922
